Name: Population Size
Configuration Settings.Description: Specifies the number of samples to evaluate per generation (preferably 5-10x number of variables).

Name: Crossover Rate
Configuration Settings.Description: Controls the rate at which dimensions of the samples are mixed (must be in [0,1]).

Name: Mutation Rate
Configuration Settings.Description: Controls the scaling of the vector differentials (must be in [0,2], preferably < 1).

Name: Mutation Rule
Configuration Settings.Description: Controls the Mutation Rate:  (varying Crossover Rate and Mutation Rate, according to [Brest2006]).

Name: Parent Selection Rule
Configuration Settings.Description: Defines the selection rule of the parent vector.

Name: Accept Rule

Options.Description: Update best sample if better than Best Ever Sample.
Accept all candiates better than parent.
Iterate through candidates and accept if Best Ever Value improved.
Accept all candidates better than Best Ever Sample.

Configuration Settings.Description: Sets the accept rule after sample mutation and evaluation.

Name: Fix Infeasible
Configuration Settings.Description: If set true, Korali samples a random sample between Parent and the voiolated boundary. If set false, infeasible samples are mutated again until feasible.

Name: Max Generations
Termination Criteria.Description: Determines how many solver generations to run before stopping execution. Execution can be resumed at a later moment.

Name: Max Infeasible Resamplings
Termination Criteria.Description: Max number of mutations per sample per generation if infeasible (only relevant if Fix Infeasible is set False).

Name: Min Value
Termination Criteria.Description: Specifies the target fitness to stop minimization.

Name: Max Value
Termination Criteria.Description: Specifies the target fitness to stop maximization.

Name: Min Value Difference Threshold
Termination Criteria.Description: Specifies the minimum fitness differential between two consecutive generations before stopping execution.

Name: Min Step Size
Termination Criteria.Description: Specifies the minimal step size of the population mean from one gneration to another.

Name: Previous Value Vector
Internal Settings.Description: Objective Function Values from previous evaluations.

Name: Current Best Value
Internal Settings.Description: Best model evaluation from current generation.

Name: Previous Best Value
Internal Settings.Description: Best model evaluation from previous generation.

Name: Best Sample Index
Internal Settings.Description: Index of the best sample in current generation.

Name: Previous Best Ever Value
Internal Settings.Description: Best ever model evaluation as of previous generation.

Name: Max Distances
Internal Settings.Description: Max distance between samples per dimension.

Name: Infeasible Sample Count
Internal Settings.Description: Keeps count of infeasible samples so far.

Name: Current Minimum Step Size
Internal Settings.Description: Minimum step size of any variable in the current generation.
